description.content: This page collects a series of frequent rules questions and answers from the Trench Crusade Discord Server. Answers provided here are those confirmed by the development team themselves. Official FAQ documents are documented in other Errata sections.

subcontent.content: When a roll is modified using Blood/Blessing/Infection Markers, are those markers discarded?
Yes, each time one or more Markers are used, remove that number of markers from the model.
For the purpose of interacting with rules that require a model having a certain base size (such as the Sin Eater’s Devour the Guilty ability), how are models on an oval base considered?
Consider the model as being on a base corresponding to the larger size. For example a Lion of Jabir (60mm x 30mm oval base) would be considered on a 60 mm base.
If an effect (e.g. Maddening Buzz or the warband being Shaken) turns all ACTIONS a model takes into RISKY ACTION, do I need to roll to see  if the model makes Move ACTIONS?
No, any ACTION that automatically succeeds without rolling the dice, such as a Standard Move, Charge or Retreat, is not affected.
Can a model that starts its activation in Melee charge another enemy, as long as it remains within 1” of any model it was in melee with at the start of the activation?

No, a model that starts its activation in Melee can only Retreat or make a Standard Move, as long as it ends this Standard Move in Melee with all model it was within 1” of at the start of the activation, and cannot bring other enemy models in melee when moved this way.
When a model charges. does it have to move all the way up to the target of the charge or can it stop the charge 1” away from it?
The charging model can choose to stop its movement at 1” or less from the target. It is not mandatory to reach base-to-base contact.

When a model is climbing a vertical surface, do you only count the vertical movement towards its movement capability for that ACTION, or do you have to take into account any horizontal movement needed to avoid the model ending the climb in mid-air? For example, can a model with a 6” movement value climb a 6” high wall if it starts its movement in contact with it, or is its maximum climb height less than 6” because it needs to move horizontally to stand on the top surface?
Horizontal movement to get to a stable surface must be counted towards the total distance moved by the model.

When a model voluntarily jumps down from a ledge, this “never costs movement”. Does this only include the vertical distance or also any horizontal movement the model has to make in order to cross the ledge?
Only the vertical drop down doesn’t cost any movement.
Can models move or be pushed wherever they want or are there restrictions on the available directions of movement or on the final position?
Movement direction is always across a surface (horizontal, vertical etc) and the model must end its movement in a position where its base can stand.

A model makes a Ranged Attack that targets “a 1×1 mm point on the battlefield the model can see” (e.g. Artillery Witch, MURAD Bombard, Burning Inferno). An enemy model is on a higher ground or behind a low wall. Since the ground below the model is not visible from the attacker’s point of view, does it mean that the attacker cannot directly target them?
If the attacking model can see a model, it can attack a point on the ground below it, even if it can’t directly see the ground.
Is the attack bonus for elevation granted to models that are 2″ or more above the target or more than 2″ ?
The bonus for elevation is granted from a height of 2” or more above the target (including 2″), which becomes 4″ or more if the target is on a 50mm or larger base.

Does a model armed with two melee weapons have to take the two Melee Attack ACTIONS one after the other or can other ACTIONS be taken between the two Attacks? Does the same extend to a model that has the possibility to make more than one Melee Attack?
Melee attacks with two (or more) different weapons are separate Melee Attack ACTIONS and other ACTIONS can be taken between an attack and the other.
Is the decision that a weapon is off-hand meant to last for the whole battle or can it be changed every time the model attacks?
It is made the first time the model attacks in Melee, and lasts for the whole battle.
Does a model always have to attack with the Off-Hand weapon last or is it only applied on a STRONG model wielding a two-handed weapon in one hand?
A model armed with two melee weapons can use them in any order unless specified.
If a TOUGH model is wearing Machine Armour and suffers an “Out of Action” result, does it go Down or does the armour effect convert the result to “Minor Hit”?
Machine Armour only treats a “Down” result (7 or 8) on the injury table as a “Minor Hit” so a TOUGH model with a Machine Armour that would be put Out of Action will go Down.
If a deployed Field Shrine is destroyed during the battle in a campaign, is it lost or can it be used again in a following battle?
Can a model armed with an arquebus or equipped with a shovel use it as a two-handed version of a trench club when they have other melee weapons as well?
Can I choose to shoot less than three times with a Machine Gun? Does my model’s activation end only when I shoot three times?
When shooting with a Machine Gun you can make up to three Ranged Attack ACTIONS. After resolving the attacks the activation of the model is over regardless of the number of attacks performed.

The rules for shields/ musical instruments/troop flags seem to imply, according to how they are written, that the model can carry one such item together with two one-handed melee weapons and two one-handed ranged weapons but can only use one weapon at a time. Is this the correct interpretation or does an item that takes a hand all the time prevent the model for carrying more than a single one-handed melee weapon and a single one-handed ranged weapon?
A shield/instrument/flag does not prevent a model to carry 2 ranged/melee weapons, as long as only one at a time is used. (Note that the passive effect of a Blasphemous Staff still works).
Can a model equipped with two items that take a hand all the time (shield/musical instrument/troop flag) be also equipped with and use grenades?
When are members of a FIRETEAM selected?
Models are assigned to a FIRETEAM before each battle.
f a member of a FIRETEAM is activated through another model’s ability (i.e Voice of God or On My Command!), can the other model in the FIRETEAM be activated as well?
Yes. Both models can be activated following the normal FIRETEAM rules.
To what rolls does the -1 DICE penalty for the keyword FEAR apply to?
FEAR applies a -1 DICE penalty to the Melee Attack rolls to hit the model with FEAR
If both players have INFILTRATORS and are allowed to use them, in which order are they deployed?

After deploying all the non-INFILTRATOR models for both warband, conduct a second round of alternate deployment for INFILTRATOR models only, beginning from the player with more INFILTRATOR (roll off if tied).
[Knights of Avarice]: Does the effect of the Standard of Mammon’s trigger when the wielder moves into melee with an enemy, or only when an enemy moves into melee with them?
[Trench Ghosts]: Do Sarcophagus Mines still count as Heretic Troopers for determining how many Legionnaires the warband can have?
No. They are a different unit.
Does a Trench Pilgrim resurrected as a Martyr Penitent keep any special abilities they had before dying, such as Zealous Strength or Wrath of God?
If a Martyr Penitent dies, can it be Resurrected again?
No, only Trench Pilgrims can be resurrected as Martyr Penitents. Once they do, they can’t be resurrected again.
When a model that is Broken on the Wheel goes Out of Action, do any Blood Markers it suffered stay on the Anchorite Shrine or are they removed?

If a Jabirean Alchemist is armed with a weapon that already possesses the keyword FIRE, GAS or SHRAPNEL, does the keyword granted by its Master of the Elements ability replace the one on that weapon, or is it in addition to the existing one?
The keyword granted by Master of the Elements is in addition to those already possessed by the weapon.
Can an Assassin use its Time Slip ability when Down?

Yes, a model who is Down is only prevented from moving “during its Activation through its own ACTION”. As Time Slip occurs during another model’s activation and it is not an ACTION,  it can be used even when the Assassin is Down.
Is the Time Slip ability of an Assassin a regular move or a teleportation effect?
[Fida’i of Alamut]: The rules for Fida’i of Alamut prohibit Dervishes from wearing Reinforced Armour. If a Dervish is promoted to ELITE during a campaign, is this restriction still in place?
No, a promoted Dervish is allowed to wear Reinforced Armour as it is now ELITE.
[House of Wisdom]: How many weapons can a House of Wisdom warband take from other lists due to its  “Weapon Collections” rule?

Up to one from New Antioch, up to one from Trench Pilgrim armoury. In either case, only a single weapon can be taken from each armoury, so for example a House of Wisdom warband can have a single Anti-Tank Hammer and a single Heavy Shotgun.
Is a Trench Cleric’s special ability chosen when the model is first created or does the model have access to all abilities and chooses one before each battle?
The ability is chosen at recruitment.
Can Combat Engineers use a Trench Shield?
As per current (1.6.3) rules, no, as Combat Engineers do not have access to additional armour options beyond Engineer Armour.

sections.title: The Cult of the Black Grail

subcontent.content: Can a Medi-Kit be used to heal INFECTION MARKERS?
No. Only effects that explicitly remove INFECTION MARKERS can do it.
Does a Grail/Fly Thrall count itself for the effect of its “Overwhelming Horde” ability?
No. It will be clarified in a future issue of the rules.
Do the melee and ranged weapons limit for the Amalgam also apply for bayonets? For example if I gave the Amalgam 2 Bolt-Action Rifles with 2 bayonets, could I also give it 2 swords?

Is the INFECTION MARKERS inflicted by a Hound of the Black Grail through the Disease Carrier ability applied before or after checking whether a model with any INFECTION MARKERS when activated gains an additional one? I.e. will a model with no INFECTION MARKERS, who starts its activation in melee combat with a Hound of the Black Grail, gain 1 or 2 INFECTION MARKERS?.
Disease Carrier triggers first, so the model will have 2 INFECTION MARKERS after it is activated.

sections.title: The Court of the Seven-Headed Serpent

subcontent.content: Some Goetic Powers have a “Praetor or Sorcerer only” restriction. Does it mean I can only  choose that power once or can both the Praetor and Sorcerer in my warband have it?
Unless the power has a LIMIT of 1, it can be taken by both the Praetor and the Sorcerer.
When a Hell Knight armed with a Heavy Flamethrower uses its Blood Magic power, does this affect both hits at the same time or only one?
Each attack is considered a separate roll, so only one is affected by Blood Magic.
[Sloth]: Does the Sloth Goetic Power Daemonium Meridianum affect flying models?
All the normal rules for Difficult Terrain apply, so flying models are not affected.

Can a Goetic Warlock using its Goetic Portal ability move together with an enemy model engaged in Melee so that this enemy ends the teleport within 1” (therefore in Melee) of a model friendly to the Warlock?
Is a model with the Point Blank skill allowed to make a regular Ranged Attack ACTION in the same activation in which it uses Point Blank to make a Ranged Attack ACTION instead of a Melee Attack?
The attack made using Point Blank replaces any Melee Attack the model is allowed to make during its activation. It can still make a regular Ranged Attack ACTIONS following the normal rules.
Does the bonus +1 DICE in Skills and Expertise apply to all ACTION (aside those noted) or do you choose a single ACTION to get +1 DICE for?
When you gain the skill, you choose a single action available to the model to get +1 DICE
Does the 100 ducats total cost of the Golem obtained through the Book of Golem location include the 40 ducats for the base model and/or the cost of equipment?
The 40 ducats base cost is included, that leaves up to 60 ducats to spend on alchemical formulas. Equipment can be bought separately and it doesn’t count towards the 100 ducats limit.
Do the Executioner’s Axe and the Champion skill stack, for 2 bonus attacks?

Does the Sample of Holy DNA’s effect to turn an INFECTION MARKER into a BLESSING MARKER when the model is activated happen before or after the INFECTION MARKER on the model generates an additional INFECTION MARKER?
Sample of Holy DNA resolves first.
Can upgrades to models (like Trench Mole for Yeomen, SKIRMISHER for Azebs, Legionnaire bonus etc.) be purchased between battles in a campaign or they are chosen at model’s creation?
They are meant to be purchasable only at model’s recruitment.

Is the correct interpretation that Krokator, The Great Tome of Hell can only be carried by a Sorcerer, but it can grant the use of a Goetic Power to any one model in the warband? If so, can the model be any model, even one that cannot normally have Goetic Powers?
No. Only the Sorcerer carrying the Tome can gain an additional Goetic Power.
Does ‘Tis but a Scratch allow the model with that skill to re-roll injuries suffered during a battle?
Confirmed typo. ‘Tis but a Scratch is intended to affect rolls on the Elite Trauma Chart.
Will the book continue the use of +DICE / -DICE and + to wound?

A small die icon should replace the “D” in +1D on weapons as folks tend to assume it means “+1 Damage”. We are planning to have a clear separate term INJURY DICE and differentiate it from the INJURY RESULT. This new terminology should be in the next revision of the rules.
correct interpretations of the rules for granting Cover?

1 to 4 are correct, 5a and 5 b are not. The terrain providing cover must be positioned so that the model can “hide” behind it to get protection, i.e. must be interposed between the attacker and target.
The Head Wound injury could use some more clarity. Does a model that loses the ELITEkeyword due to a Head Wound lose access to any ELITE only skills/upgrades they had? What about injuries?
Concerning equipment: is the model still able to use any ELITE only item it was equipped with and it is simply prohibited from gaining more, or must it give away all ELITE only items until recovery?
When a model recovers, does it regain every XP/skill/upgrade/injury it lost, or is it considered a “new” ELITE and it starts back from 0 XP ?
Here is the revised description from the next version:
This model is no longer considered ELITE for gaining Experience but is otherwise unaffected. It can regain this via promotion, representing recovery. In this case, the Scar still remains.
Are any additional BLOOD MARKERS inflicted by FIRE/GAS/SHRAPNEL applied before or after the injury roll?
After the injury roll. All these Keywords will follow this format in the next version of the rules:

If the Success Roll for an attack made with a weapon with this Keyword is a Success or Critical Success, one BLOOD MARKER is added to the target in addition to any other effects of the attack after making the injury roll. N.B. The BLOOD MARKER is added to the model as long as the result for the attack is a Success or Critical Success, even if it has no other effects or is otherwise negated
Is there a limit on the number of BLOOD MARKERS a model can have?
Yes, a model cannot have more than six BLOOD MARKERS at the same time. Same applies to BLESSING and INFECTION MARKERS.
Are all models in warband variants that replace the mandatory leader supposed to gain the keyword LEADER?

Assuming the answer to the previous question is yes, what happens if the LEADER model dies? Do I need to buy another copy of that model who gains the keyword LEADER or can I give the keyword to another eligible model in the warband?
Yes, these models all have LEADER Keyword in the next revision of the rules. If this model is lost, the Keyword is lost with it unless you buy a replacement.
Can a model attack twice in Melee with an Automatic Pistol?

No. The Automatic Pistol can only attack twice when used to make a Ranged Attack ACTION. Although an attack in Melee with an Automatic Pistol uses the Ranged characteristic of the model, it is still considered a Melee Attack ACTION.
At which moment can I resurrect a Trench Pilgrim as a Martyr Penitent?

Immediately after the Trench Pilgrim dies (in the “injury” step of the Post-battle sequence, so before any exploration and chance for reinforcements). You need to have the ducats to pay for the resurrection available at that moment.
If both warbands need to roll for morale and they have the same number of models, who rolls first?
Roll off to see who goes first.
If an Anchorite Shrine has a model Broken on the Wheel that is still in play, can the opponent spend BLOOD MARKERS on the broken model to apply -DICE to the Shrine’s ACTIONS?
Yes. As stated in the rules: or all rules purposes and attack effects (such as forced movement), the two models are treated as a single model, including sharing BLOOD, INFECTION and BLESSING MARKERS.
